alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Decatur; Rawlins; Sheridan; Sherman; Thomas (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 26 at 9:36PM CDT until July 26 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM MDT/1030 PM CDT/ FOR EASTERN CHEYENNE...THOMAS...RAWLINS... SHERIDAN...DECATUR AND NORTHEASTERN SHERMAN COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN KANSAS... At 835 PM MDT/935 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles north of Ludell to 9 miles north of Gem to 5 miles south of Colby, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Mesonet. At 931 PM CDT, a 60 mph wind gust was reported near Atwood. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Rexford, Herndon and Gem around 950 PM CDT. Selden and Menlo around 1000 PM CDT. Dresden around 1010 PM CDT. Hoxie and Jennings around 1020 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Blakeman, Mingo, Leoville, Traer, Halford, Seguin and Cedar Bluffs. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 36 and 67. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These thunderstorms will produce damaging winds resulting in areas of near zero visibility in blowing dirt. Use extreme caution if you must travel and be alert for rapidly changing visibility. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.

area.areaDesc: Cheyenne; Decatur; Rawlins; Sheridan; Sherman; Thomas
